activities.description: David Wong draws a guide box on the floor using a chalk marker and his own feet as measurement tools.
David Wong explains how the guide box can be used for practicing the wooden dummy form even without having a physical dummy.

chun dummy what you do is you start with the leg of the wing chun dummy if you don't have a wing chun dummy you can start anywhere just start on the point on the ground so the leg here ends up here so this is our starting point and from here we want to measure two feet two of your actual foot so one two and then you put another point here and then you just draw a line from there to the original two like imperial feet two of your own feet length and just connect that together now you have this and now you connect this together and then in the middle you just connect the one in the middle here and then it's helpful to put some halfway markers here and later on in the form we're gonna actually use this part here which is another two feet so we can go like this and put a mark here and also do timecoded_text_to_speech.text: Welcome to David Wong's Wind & Dummy course.
In this video I'm going to show you how to use chalk or use tape to make a guide box
on the ground so you can learn how to do the Wind & Dummy form properly.
Because footwork is very important in this form.
So if you have the guide on the ground then you will be able to follow along.
So let's begin.
So if you do have a Wind & Dummy what you do is you start with the leg of the Wind & Dummy.
If you don't have a Wind & Dummy you can start anywhere.
Just start on the point on the ground.
So the leg here ends up here.
So this is our starting point.
And from here we want to measure two feet, two of your actual foot.
So one, two, and then you put another point here.
And then you just draw a line from there to the original point.
Now you can do it going in the other direction.
One, two feet, put a point here and draw a line going from there to there.
Now from each, now you have this line going straight down this way.
Now at the corners you want to go 90 degrees and do two feet.
And then you do another point here and then connect that.
And you do the same thing over on this side.
Two feet.
And then two of your own feet, not actually two like a Imperial feet, two of your own
feet length.
And just connect that together.
Now you have this and now you connect this together.
And then in the middle you just connect the one in the middle here.
And then it's helpful to put some halfway markers here.
And later on in the form we're going to actually use this part here which is another two
feet.
So we can go like this, put a mark here and also do it on this side.
Measure two feet, one, two, and then draw a line there.
So even if you don't have a wind dummy, if you have this drawn on the ground or you
could use tape, maybe you don't have chalk and you don't want to write on the ground.
Just use masking tape and make the same measurements on the ground.
And your starting point would be like this.
So you just imagine there's a wind dummy leg that ends up here.

★☆★ About David Wong, "The Frequency Expert” ★☆★

David is a health-tech founder, celebrated author, innovative inventor, executive producer, motivational speaker, martial artist, qi gong practitioner, and pioneering entrepreneur. As the visionary founder of Qi Life, his mission is to bring forth groundbreaking wellness technologies that seamlessly blend ancient wisdom with modern science, specializing in Qi Energy and life mastery.

With a vision rooted in accessible wellness for all, David imagines a world where achieving complete mental and physical well-being is easy, sidestepping the need for medication or invasive treatments. His transformative journey began with his remarkable recovery from a decade-long "incurable" digestive disease, using only frequency and energy devices within a span of under 90 days.

David's relentless pursuit of wellness innovation has birthed a series of frequency-based marvels, including the Qi Coil™, Qi Coil Aura™, Qi Lite™, Qi Tones™ and QiEnergy.Ai. Merging timeless wisdom with cutting-edge science, he has unlocked secrets to longevity, anti-aging, peak fitness, and beauty, fostering happiness and heightened mind states—qualities many believe to be our innate superpowers.

Dedicated to aiding fellow seekers in their transformation, David champions the mantra of improving by 1% daily to unlock human potential, aiming to elevate the global resonance through healing.

Residing in Canada, David indulges in qi gong, piano, and martial arts in his leisure time, drawing inspiration from Bruce Lee as a third-generation student, alongside his faithful canine companions.
